metadata.title: CVE-2020-15861 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Net-SNMP through 5.7.3 allows Escalation of Privileges because of UNIXsymbolic link (symlink) following.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15861` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsnmp-base - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.3+esm1
libsnmp-perl - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.3+esm1
libsnmp30 - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.3+esm1
python-netsnmp - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.3+esm1
snmp - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.3+esm1
snmpd - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.3+esm1
tkmib - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.3+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: net-snmp package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.3+esm1').
